seo.title: Hostel Brikette → Positano ferry dock (port)
seo.description: Step-by-step walking route to Positano’s port with map landmarks, ticket tips, and boarding guidance.

intro: Heading to Positano’s port for a ferry? This is the easiest walk we’ve found from Hostel Brikette to Spiaggia Grande — with a quick map and photo landmarks for points 1–5.
Allow 20–30 minutes on foot (more with luggage), and note that Google Maps sometimes suggests longer detours to the beach — follow the route below instead.
beforeList: Check ferry times and prices at the operator booths at the port (they list the next departure on the sign).
Leave a buffer if you have luggage — there are stairs on this route and the port gets busy at peak times.
Aim to arrive early so you can buy tickets, find the right pier, and be ready when boarding starts.

sections.title: Getting to the port
body: Begin at the hostel and head towards Spiaggia Grande (Positano’s main beach).
The port is located on the right-hand side of the beach.
Allow 20–30 minutes for the walk from the hostel to the port.
Google Maps may not always provide the most direct route to the beach — use the map and step-by-step directions below.

[See here if you prefer map directions](https://www.google.com/maps/dir/Brikette+Hostel,+Via+G.+Marconi,+358,+84017+Positano+SA/Positano+Spiaggia/@40.6290767,14.4840629,16z/data=!4m14!4m13!1m5!1m1!1s0x133b97669dd0003b:0xf11f22a59b1b00da!2m2!1d14.480818!2d40.629634!1m5!1m1!1s0x133b976916d1a44d:0xf1e08d61658b4291!2m2!1d14.4878892!2d40.6276549!3e2).

sections.title: Walk from Hostel Brikette to the port (points 1–5)
body: Map reference (Hostel → Port):
[[figure:map]]
Begin by exiting the hostel via the main door.
Go down the steps to the road.
Turn left and walk just over 100 metres (330 feet) until you reach point 1 on the map.
At point 1, take the right-hand turn.
[[figure:point-1]]
As soon as you turn right at point 1, you’ll see the tabacchi on the right.
[[figure:tabacchi]]
Follow the road downhill.
At the first switchback bend, you’ll have reached point 2 on the map.
At point 2, go off the road and walk straight ahead, taking the stairs.
[[figure:point-2]]
When you reach the end of the stairs, you’ll have arrived at point 3 on the map.
Cross the road and take the path straight ahead.
Follow the stairs down until you reach the next level.
[[figure:point-3]]
When you reach the end of the stairs, you’ll arrive at the road.
Cross over the road and turn left, walking 10 metres (30 feet) until you reach point 4 on the map.
At point 4, turn right and take the stairs that lead off the road and downhill.
[[figure:point-4]]
Follow the stairs down until you reach the bottom. At the bottom of the stairs, turn right.
This will bring you to point 5 on the map.
Continue under the archway on the right.
[[figure:point-5]]
After 50 metres (160 feet), you’ll reach the port.

sections.title: Buying ferry tickets
body: At the Positano port you can catch ferries to places like Amalfi, Capri, and beyond. Each ferry operator has a booth, and the sign on the booth displays information about the next ferry they will run.
[[figure:tickets]]

sections.title: Boarding a ferry
body: Once you have your ticket, walk to the end of the port and wait for the ferry to commence boarding.
[[figure:port]]

stepsList: Leave the hostel and turn left along the road until point 1 on the map, then turn right.
Follow the route down via points 2–5 (stairs and crossings) until you reach the port.
Buy tickets at the operator booths and check the sign for the next sailing.
Walk to the end of the port and wait for boarding.

faqs.q: How long does it take to walk from Hostel Brikette to the port?
a: Plan for 20–30 minutes on foot. Add extra time if you have luggage or want to stop to buy tickets before boarding.

faqs.q: Where do I buy ferry tickets in Positano?
a: At the port you will see booths for each ferry operator. The sign on the booth shows information about the next ferry they will run.

howtoSteps: Follow the map route from the hostel down to the port
Use photo landmarks at points 1–5 to stay on track
Buy tickets at the operator booths and confirm the next sailing
Wait at the pier and board when called
